author: mininny
content:
Hi team, during our testing with pectra/peerdas devnet, we noticed that lodestar showed considerably higher block propagation time compared to other consensus clients, and also was the only client that had reorgs happening. Also, it didn't seem to be particularly correlated with the number of blobs in the block (as we've increased the blobs from 0 to 72). You can view the grafana graphs in these reports: [1](https://testinprod.notion.site/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-03-11-1b38fc57f54680d8a35dfa4cfb8b852c?pvs=4), [2](https://testinprod.notion.site/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-03-18-1ba8fc57f54680a29153e02aaf684620?pvs=4) 
We'd appreciate any help from <@&595681771690000403> with debugging why this is happening. I'd be happy to provide any logs / metrics or further testing that would be required as well üôè

author: dmitriishmatko
content: yeah, just boolean, keeping it simple

author: dmitriishmatko
content: so if it's optimistic=true we could expect that not all columns could be available, we could get some but it's not guaranteed

author: tersec
content: as a nomenclature point, this would be the third or fourth semi-distinct meaning of "optimistic"

author: parithosh
content: Could we have a list of client devs working on peerdas for each client team? We're making a new role per person, this role gets tagged on the devnet-alert chat here https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1340943777715716136 so that everyone involved knows there's a bug in the client and gets daily hive updates.

author: parithosh
content: Does someone have a list of client branches that work with cell proof computation? have we managed to get local interop working already?

author: mininny
content: Hi team, now I'm running a new peerdas devnet with 25 lighthouse-geth pair and 25 prysm-geth pair (with 50/50 full/super node). As I'm having the nodes sync from genesis, I noticed 3-4 prysm nodes (supernodes) forking off the chain and slowly progressing on their own. I think just wiping out the db and restarting these nodes would make it work, but I figured we might want to do some root debugging on why this happens. Would anyone from the prysm team be interested about this issue?

author: dmitriishmatko
content: Did PeerDAS test involved data column reconstruction from EL on supernodes? I think it's crucial to help limited bandwidth home stakers to get blocks included and DA happen.

author: manunlp
content: Yes, please send me a kurtosis enclave dump, and if possible a screenshot of dora where issues start to happen. As well as the kurtosis configuration file.
